result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Status conference on July 13, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.

10:16 AM Defendant in court with Attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides.  Carl Jacob Lazarus appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State called first witness. Officer White duly sworn & testified. Direct by State. Cross by defense. State moved for bind over. Objection and argument by defense. Rebuttal by State. Court granted motion to bind over.
Defendant came in to window staff to pick up notice for 5-6-2022 preliminary hearing that is scheduled. -ls

11:01 AM Attorney Fredrickson contacted Court and indicated defendant intends to pick up notice in hand. If defendant appears, please generate and provide notice for 5/6/2022 Preliminary Hearing. Court vacated warrant.
BODY ONLY

09:56 AM Attorney Paul M Fredrickson in court on behalf of defendant.  Frank John Remington appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State requested warrant. Defense requested warrant be held until 4:00 PM. Court granted with conditional hold.
Preliminary hearing on April 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.

02:06 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Paul M Fredrickson.  Carl Jacob Lazarus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Forrest J MacDonald appeared by video means with Attorney.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Status conference on March 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
- Defendant shall not be at or around Walgreens on E Washington except only as necessary to obtain legitimate prescriptions. 
Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 17

02:49 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Diana Maria Van Rybroek.  Lillian Rose Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
